column1: There’s very little faith among experts that Trump will change his current approach to the pandemic...Those 200000 deaths are on the US’s record forever. But Biden could take actions that would help.  GOTV for the only candidate with a COVID plan. https://t.co/jdd6LSHBtW

If you didn’t vote using a mail-in ballot you can and should go to the polls today. Just be sure to follow CDC guidelines to help slow the spread of COVID-19.  Less than two hours left to get in line. To find your polling location: https://t.co/abwykeyv0P https://t.co/bpxZM6T9wb

Voting in person is relatively safe even amid the Covid-19 pandemic...roughly as risky as going to the grocery store something Americans still do regularly.  If you haven't voted you still can in person today--just take precautions Pennsylvanians! https://t.co/36HmyAfkXQ

Before anyone knew of COVID Joe Biden cautioned that we weren't prepared for a pandemic. In the year since @JoeBiden tweeted this warning on Oct 25 2019 President Trump's mismanagement of this crisis has left hundreds of thousands of Americans dead & millions more out of work. https://t.co/9aMKffGT8H

Today's #PABallotBoxoftheDay is outside the Upper Dublin Municipal Building in Fort Washington. Social distance friendly. Is a little shy so be sure to check https://t.co/duCTd3oCfC for hours of operation. 13/10 wide open spaces https://t.co/g8Kjw4cVEY
Oh. The Pennsylvanians I hear from want COVID relief quality & affordable health care and protections for their pre-existing conditions. https://t.co/HlOHn25GRN

Bucks County and 11 others in the state are in the top 20% nationally for both the increase in their unemployment rates from a year earlier and deaths per capita linked to Covid-19  Pennsylvania deserves better than another four years of this. https://t.co/wAcg9ka9g3

President Trump's failure to respond to COVID-19 has left many workers struggling to access needed PPE and worsened the human and economic toll of the virus unnecessarily.  You know what’s next? Corporate interests challenging the right to organize a union. That can’t happen. /8

Last night @JoeBiden gave thoughtful answers to voters' questions about COVID taxes racial equity & more.  President Trump was combative & spun more conspiracies.  Working families deserve a president who will fight for them. Joe Biden will be that President.

PA's COVID cases have increased 63% in the last month.  Unemployment remains in the double digits.  But instead of working on a plan to help PA through this crisis and get us back to work President Trump is in the Commonwealth to lie to working families and smear Joe Biden.

Even before COVID-19 hit the economy wasn't working for working people. Join me @SherrodBrown & PA @AFLCIO on my Facebook page at 2 PM ET as we discuss how our Nation can create a 21st century American economy that works for everyone.

Last night Vice President Biden laid out clear plans to contain COVID-19 rebuild our economy and protect health care coverage for millions of Americans. President Trump demonstrated why the American people should fire him.

You can't fix the economy until you fix the COVID crisis.  @JoeBiden knows we can't have a healthy economy without healthy people period. Which is why he has a plan to control this virus and #BuildBackBetter. https://t.co/5SIn1MP1Vl

Over 8000 Pennsylvanians have lost their lives to COVID-19. Over 200000 families across America are grieving. And the President would rather slander @JoeBiden than take responsibility for his failure. #Debates2020

That’s not just because of COVID-19; even before the pandemic Trump had weakened our economy by forcing us into a losing trade war and enacting anti-worker policies that favor the wealthy and well-connected instead of good union jobs. https://t.co/7ZbeFpI0vZ

Under President Trump American families are not safe. President Trump's failed leadership has allowed a pandemic to course throughout the nation unchecked. His mismanagement of COVID-19 has destroyed our economy and his rhetoric continues to incite violence. https://t.co/Rucodrhhcw
Imagine being proud of your coronavirus response when 180000 Americans are dead. #RNC2020

As #RNC2020 touts President Trump's "accomplishments" families across America are sitting at their kitchen table emotionally spent from mourning the loss of a loved one to COVID-19 while trying to figure out how to pay rent with minimal unemployment benefits.
White House advisor Larry Kudlow talked about the coronavirus pandemic in the past tense as if it ended.  178k Americans have died including over a thousand since just yesterday.
...and tell our friends and neighbors how he plans to get them back to work and help them recover from the economic impact of COVID-19. It's time to hold President Trump accountable.

Pennsylvania will vote for the strong and steady leadership of Joe Biden. I know that Joe can bring our Nation together to defeat the virus counter the economic impacts of COVID-19 and help us "Build Back Better."

The Vice President should explain what the Administration will do to compensate for the multiple failures in the response to the virus and COVID-19 which has killed over 150000 Americans and over 7100 Pennsylvanians. https://t.co/KNztU5sA92

In January the new President will still be dealing with COVID or its aftermath. While President Trump has been busy selling beans from the Oval Office @JoeBiden put forth a plan to raise wages &support our workers & small businesses. Choose your fighter. https://t.co/fdYI34seHZ

At this make-or-break moment for middle-class families America needs Joe Biden to lead us out of the #COVID19 crisis. That's because Joe understands what the current President does not: we can't just build back we need to #BuildBackBetter  https://t.co/igrlvTDsqv

Teachers and caregivers are on the front lines of this pandemic but even before #COVID our Nation was experiencing a caregiving crisis. That's why @JoeBiden's #BuildBackBetter plan includes a robust 21st century caregiving and education workforce.  More: https://t.co/guWvidreLV

As the Senate returns to legislative business this week pay attention to how hard Democrats are pushing for additional #COVID19 relief for you and your family and how hard Republicans are trying to stop us.  This is why elections matter.

While President Trump has been busy selling beans from the Oval Office @JoeBiden put forth a plan to raise wages & support our workers & small businesses dealing with #COVID19.  In January the new President will still be dealing with COVID or its aftermath. Choose your fighter.

It’s been 140 days since President Trump said we’d soon have zero #COVID19 cases in the U.S.  Under his Administration’s watch we now have 3.5 million cases and have suffered the loss of more than 139000 Americans.  That's it. That's the tweet.
On Inauguration Day 2021 the newly-inaugurated President will still be dealing with COVID or its aftermath. Joe Biden is ready. https://t.co/bRyr3Cfxqu

Happy Monday! This week and every week I'm committed to wearing a mask in public social distancing and following other CDC guidelines in order to help my community fight the #COVID19 crisis. Retweet if you're with me.

If you're planning on voting or dropping off your ballot in-person be sure to follow safety measures to protect yourself and others: wash your hands before and after wear a mask and maintain social distance.

The #COVID19 pandemic is exacerbating the challenges that rural communities face. While the President has abandoned the needs of rural communities Joe has a proven track record of both sticking to his promises and achieving substantial legislative change. https://t.co/lOwktYXmMF

Our front line workers are soldiers keeping us safe in the war against COVID-19. As Americans on the front lines continue to risk their own health and safety to fight this virus to #VoteByMail is to thank a front line worker. https://t.co/3DQmvr83Gp

While we've seen the #COVID19 pandemic disrupt primary elections across the country I'm calling on Pennsylvanians to not let this crisis take away their constitutional right to vote. The deadline to register for the 6/2 primary is TONIGHT: https://t.co/EOYE1MFLlm #ReadyToVotePA
Thank you to all the frontline workers during the COVID-19 pandemic #SOULSaturday https://t.co/jKHcUCctWs
